Ratio Description: hemithyroidectomy VERSUS nonoperative active surveillance IN Specific disease- micropapillary thyroid cancer (mPTC); Age- 19 to 40 years, 41 to 64 years, >=65 years; Gender- Both; Country- United States; Other- biopsy-proven, unifocal mPTC without features that would necessitate immediate operation (such as unfavorable location near the trachea or recurrent laryngeal nerve, high-grade features on biopsy, or nodal disease).
Target Population: Specific disease- micropapillary thyroid cancer (mPTC); Age- 19 to 40 years, 41 to 64 years, >=65 years; Gender- Both; Country- United States; Other- biopsy-proven, unifocal mPTC without features that would necessitate immediate operation (such as unfavorable location near the trachea or recurrent laryngeal nerve, high-grade features on biopsy, or nodal disease).
Title: Cost-effectiveness of active surveillance versus hemithyroidectomy for micropapillary thyroid cancer.
